ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: We have received all the material sanctioned under MPLADS and these units were inaugurated on 10th Nov 2015. Physiotherapy Unit was inaugurated by our Speaker Sir and Occupational Therapy Unit was inaugurated by Sri Peddi Venkateswara Rao (Senior Lawyer), Early Intervention and Sensory Unit by Sri Modugula garu and Special Education Department by Sri N.Tirupataiah garu (President â€“ Senior Citizens Welfare Association). One special child by name Deepa D is having problem with speech at the time of joining and after doing the hearing evaluation we could successfully support her by providing Hearing Aids for both ears with the help of a Donor and now she is able to speak within 8 months. One Special Child (Autism) Master Manish Y appeared for 10th class through APOSS and cleared 4 papers out of 5. On the occasion of Helen Keller Jayanthi conducted by SAKSHAM 3 children got prizes in Drawing Competition.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: MAJOR ACTIVITIES/ ACHIEVEMENTS Pragathi Charities has taken up challenging measures for running Special Schools for multiple disabled to cater the education needs of the Disabled Community under the provocation of the Government in Nellore District, Pragathi Charities has taken up the following programmes for the benefits of the disabled in Nellore District of Andhra Pradesh state. 1) SPECIAL SCHOOL FOR MENTALLY RETARDED, WOOD COMPLEX, NELLORE : This school has grown up in several ways to meet the increasing case load and developed as a full-fledged school, Out of 150 beneficiaries 90 are hostlers the remaining 30 children are day scholars. The organization has recruited 27 members of staff as per staff pattern and guidelines from by Ministry of Social Justice, GOI during 2013-14. 2) SPECIAL SCHOOL FOR HEARING HANDICAPPED, NELLORE : There are 80 students in the school out of which 46 are Hostlers the remaining 26 children are day scholars. The organization has recruited 20 members of staff as per staff pattern and guidelines from by Ministry of Social Justice, GOI during 2013-14. RECOGNITION:- This organization has been registered under PWD act vide 1. Certificates of Recognition (No 2 of 2003) up to 18.08.2017. 2. Certificate of form B grant of Recognition (No 2 of 2003) up to 30.9.2015 by the Asst. Director welfare disabled and Sr. Citizens, SPSR, Nellore Dist. Dated 11.10.2012. 3. This Special School has been recognized by the State Government from 2003-04 from Ist to VIIth Class vide Rc.No.6226/A7/2009 dated 09-11-2009 of the District Educational Officer (FAC), Nellore and renewed the recognition vide DEOâ€™s RC NO.9470/B1/2012 dt. 06-07-2013. We are getting 100% results both in VII and X Classes every year. We are sending VIII to Xth Class students for the Examinations every year as Private candidates. Distribution of free Books: the Distinct Educational Officer Nellore, has supplied free N.T. Books to all the hearing unimpaired childrenâ€™s from 1st to 10th Class- every year 3) TRAINING PROGRAMMES (Human Resource Developments) :- 1) Special B. Ed. ( MR) :- The another achievement under Man Power development is that we have started â€œCollege of Special Education B. Ed. â€“ Mental Retardationâ€ from 2007-08 with 25 No. of students which is permitted by the RCI, New Delhi and affiliated by Sri Venkateswara University â€“ Tirupati and Vikram Simhapuri University Nellore. A Total 144 candidates are appeared for the Spl. B.Ed(MR) Course and passed 136 candidates successfully as detailed here under from 2007-08 to 2014-15. 95% candidates who passed Spl. B.Ed (MR) have got employment in Rajiv Vidya Mission in various Districts in the state of Andhra Pradesh and Maharashtra. 2) D.C.B.R. Course :- We have started Diploma in Community Based Rehabilitation Course during 2006-07 with 20 Noâ€™s. But now it is discontinued. 3) Special D.Ed ( MR) Course: This course started in August 2015 with the permission of Rehabilitation Council of India, New Delhi and affiliated to NIEPMD, Chennai. 25 Candidates appeared for the Examination in the month of Juneâ€™2016 and waiting for Results. 4) Special D.Ed ( HI) Course: This course started in August 2016 with the permission of Rehabilitation Council of India, New Delhi and affiliated to AYJNIHH, Mumbai. 21 Candidates are admitted, during the academic year 2016-17.. 3) District Disabled Rehabilitation Resource Centre :- The Consulate general of JAPAN (Chennai) has caused Inspection of this Project during 2007 â€“ 08 and sanctioned grant to the Project in 2009 â€“ 10. We have started this District Disabled Rehabilitation Resource Centre (D.D.R.R.C.) with the support of JAPAN Consulate with an estimate of Rs.44 Lakhs for constructing 12 Rooms at Ambapuram Village, Nellore Mandal. The Consulate General of Japan, G.G.P. Unit, Chennai has released US Dollars 97,087 worth Rs.44 Lakhs and the Construction of these DRRC building has completed and inaugurated on 27.3.2013 by Masanori Nakano, consul â€“ consulate general of Japan at Chennai. Vocational trainings like candle Making, chalk piece Making, Tailoring, computer Education training etc. are started to the disabled.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: We organized the Black Level Sports Meet in collaboration with Nehru Yuva Kendra Guntur. We took precautionary measures to prevent any trouble for the sports players. as well as we arranged a good meal and doctors. Shields and certificates were presented to the sports players that won the games by guests from various disciplines. Putting on any sports meet will improve the way young people think and body health. The Nehru Yuva Kendra Guntur also apprised us for organizing the event very well.

We conducted the Life Skill Education Training Program in collaboration with Nehru Yuva Kendra Guntur. We conducted three months of free training in tailoring and embroidery for urban and poor women unemployed. We have also arranged for some women who have shown talent in tailoring to set up their own shop.
As part of the Purity Hi Service program, an environmental clean-up program was conducted with school students

It was Register in the year 2003 under the Government of Andhra Pradesh Societies reconization act 35 of 2001 .It was working for the welfare and development of the neglected downtrodden communities and implementing several development all activities i.e. child labour welfare program, consumer welfare program, HIV/Aids awareness program, street child labour welfare programms vocational skills training programmms, or phone welfare programms , national environmental awareness programms (ministry of environment and forests, government of India, new Delhi) non formal â€“adults) education programms, clean and green program ,woman empowerment program ,old age welfare programms ,widows welfare programms, public and tribal area people since its inception. This society service to all castes, race ,creed, and relies without any discrimination since 2003.The society has conducted special services in rural slum, remote areas in Andhra Pradesh and resourcing state of the Andhra Pradesh state

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: CBOs are strengthened to mobilize government resource. Permanent habitable houses are constructed which serve as an asset to women. Quality health care is provided affordable costs. Access to revolving fund is created to women to take up feasible income generating schemes. Rainwater harvesting measures are taken up on a large scale to conserve rainwater and best water management practices are followed to optimise the use of groundwater. Improved varieties of livestock was developed.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: RDT believes in collaboration with government and it has been playing a complementary role in certain programs of development. It is executing SWACCH BHARATH Program by way of constructing over 40,000 bathrooms cum toilets.
